barronSpline(float, float, float) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.OtherMath

BLUE_NOISE - com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.Dithered.DitherAlgorithm
This is an ordered dither that modifies any error in a pixel's color by using a blue-noise pattern and a checkerboard pattern.

C

centralize(byte) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.OtherMath
Given a byte, pushes any value that isn't extreme toward the center of the 0 to 255 range, and keeps extreme values (such as the channel values in the colors max green or black) as they are.
centralizePalette(FileHandle, FileHandle) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PNG8
Given a FileHandle to read from and a FileHandle to write to, duplicates the input FileHandle and edits the red, green, and blue channels of each color in its palette (which is all colors in the image) by running each channel through a function (OtherMath.centralize(byte)) that biases any channel values that aren't extreme toward the center of their range, and keeps extreme values (such as max green, or black) as they are.
centralizePalette(FileHandle, FileHandle, float) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PNG8
Given a FileHandle to read from and a FileHandle to write to, duplicates the input FileHandle and edits the red, green, and blue channels of each color in its palette (which is all colors in the image) by running each channel through a function (OtherMath.centralize(byte)) that biases any channel values that aren't extreme toward the center of their range, and keeps extreme values (such as max green, or black) as they are.
CHAOTIC_NOISE - com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.Dithered.DitherAlgorithm
Very similar to Dithered.DitherAlgorithm.BLUE_NOISE for a still frame, albeit less orderly, but in an animation this will change wildly from frame to frame, taking an ordered dither (one which uses the same blue noise texture that Dithered.DitherAlgorithm.BLUE_NOISE does) and incorporating one of the qualities of an error-diffusion dither to make each frame dither differently.

com.github.tommyettinger.anim8 - package com.github.tommyettinger.anim8
 
compareSwap(int[], int, int) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Compares items in ints by their luma, looking up items by the indices a and b, and swaps the two given indices if the item at a has higher luma than the item at b.

DIFFUSION - com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.Dithered.DitherAlgorithm
Floyd-Steinberg error-diffusion dithering; this is the best option for still images, and it's an OK option for some animated images.

getPalette() - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PNG8
 
GRADIENT_NOISE - com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.Dithered.DitherAlgorithm
Jorge Jimenez' Gradient Interleaved Noise, modified slightly to use as an ordered dither here; this can be, well, noisy, but doesn't have different amounts of noise on different frames or different parts of an image (which is a potential problem for Dithered.DitherAlgorithm.DIFFUSION).

H

HALTONIC - Static variable in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
This 255-color (plus transparent) palette uses the (3,5,7) Halton sequence to get 3D points, treats those as IPT channel values, and rejects out-of-gamut colors.

hueShift() - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Edits this PaletteReducer by changing each used color so lighter colors lean towards warmer hues, while darker colors lean toward cooler or more purple-ish hues.

L

loadPreloadFile(FileHandle) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
If you saved a preload file with PaletteReducer.writePreloadFile(FileHandle), you can load it and give it to a constructor with: new PaletteReducer(intColors, PaletteReducer.loadPreloadFile(theFile)), where intColors is the original int array of RGBA8888 colors and theFile is the preload file written previously.

N

NONE - com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.Dithered.DitherAlgorithm
Doesn't dither at all; this generally looks bad unless the palette matches the colors in the image very closely or exactly.

PATTERN - com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.Dithered.DitherAlgorithm
Thomas Knoll's Pattern Dither (with a skew to obscure grid artifacts), as originally described by Joel Yliluoma in this dithering article.

probit(double) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.OtherMath
A way of taking a double in the (0.0, 1.0) range and mapping it to a Gaussian or normal distribution, so high inputs correspond to high outputs, and similarly for the low range.

Retrieves a random non-transparent color from the palette this would reduce to, with a higher likelihood for colors that are used more often in reductions (those with few similar colors).

RAW_BLUE_NOISE - Static variable in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
This should always be a 4096-element byte array filled with 64 sections of 64 bytes each.
readChunks(InputStream) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PNG8
Simple PNG IO from https://www.java-tips.org/java-se-tips-100019/23-java-awt-image/2283-png-file-format-decoder-in-java.html .
reduce(Pixmap) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Modifies the given Pixmap so it only uses colors present in this PaletteReducer, dithering when it can using Scatter dithering (this merely delegates to PaletteReducer.reduceScatter(Pixmap)).
reduce(Pixmap, Dithered.DitherAlgorithm) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Uses the given Dithered.DitherAlgorithm to decide how to dither pixmap.
reduceBlueNoise(Pixmap) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
A blue-noise-based dither; does not diffuse error, and uses a tiling blue noise pattern (which can be accessed with PaletteReducer.RAW_BLUE_NOISE, but shouldn't usually be modified) as well as a fine-grained checkerboard pattern and a roughly-white-noise pattern obtained by distorting th blue noise, but only applies these noisy pattern when there's error matching a color from the image to a color in the palette.
reduceChaoticNoise(Pixmap) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
A white-noise-based dither; uses the colors encountered so far during dithering as a sort of state for basic pseudo-random number generation, while also using some blue noise from a tiling texture to offset clumping.
reduceFloat(float) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Looks up color as if it was part of an image being color-reduced and finds the closest color to it in the palette this holds.
reduceFloydSteinberg(Pixmap) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Modifies the given Pixmap so it only uses colors present in this PaletteReducer, dithering when it can using the commonly-used Floyd-Steinberg dithering.
reduceIndex(int) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Looks up color as if it was part of an image being color-reduced and finds the closest color to it in the palette this holds.
reduceInPlace(Color) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Modifies color so its RGB values will match the closest color in this PaletteReducer's palette.
reduceJimenez(Pixmap) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
 
reduceKnoll(Pixmap) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Reduces a Pixmap to the palette this knows by using Thomas Knoll's pattern dither, which is out-of-patent since late 2019.
reduceKnollRoberts(Pixmap) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Reduces a Pixmap to the palette this knows by using a skewed version of Thomas Knoll's pattern dither, which is out-of-patent since late 2019, using the harmonious numbers rediscovered by Martin Roberts to handle the skew.
reduceScatter(Pixmap) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Modifies the given Pixmap so it only uses colors present in this PaletteReducer, using Floyd-Steinberg to dither but modifying patterns slightly by introducing triangular-distributed blue noise.
reduceSierraLite(Pixmap) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Modifies the given Pixmap so it only uses colors present in this PaletteReducer, dithering when it can using Sierra Lite dithering instead of the Floyd-Steinberg dithering that PaletteReducer.reduce(Pixmap) uses.
reduceSingle(int) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Looks up color as if it was part of an image being color-reduced and finds the closest color to it in the palette this holds.
reduceSolid(Pixmap) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Modifies the given Pixmap so it only uses colors present in this PaletteReducer, without dithering.
repeat - Variable in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.AnimatedGif
 

S

SCATTER - com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.Dithered.DitherAlgorithm
The yin to to Dithered.DitherAlgorithm.CHAOTIC_NOISE's yang; where chaotic noise actively scrambles pixels using uniform blue noise and some slightly-error-diffusion-like qualities to act as if it had a white noise source, this tries to subtly alter the more rigidly-defined error-diffusion dither of Dithered.DitherAlgorithm.DIFFUSION with a small amount of triangular-distributed blue noise, and doesn't introduce white noise.

TRI_BLUE_NOISE - Static variable in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
Very similar to PaletteReducer.RAW_BLUE_NOISE, a 4096-element byte array as a 64x64 grid of bytes.
TRI_BLUE_NOISE_MULTIPLIERS - Static variable in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PaletteReducer
A 64x64 grid of doubles, with a median value of about 1.0, generated using the triangular-distributed blue noise from PaletteReducer.TRI_BLUE_NOISE.

writePrecisely(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PNG8
Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to file; this attempt will only succeed if there are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent).
